intro: Tricholaena teneriffae var. tibestica, commonly known as the Cameroon bamboo, is a rare and distinctive plant native to the tropical regions of Cameroon. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender culms that can reach several meters in height. The plant exhibits a clumping growth habit and has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found in mountainous areas with well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
